result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul T Dorst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent.  Submit to random urinalysis.  Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol, unless prescribed by doctor and used accordingly.  Provide Rx to agent within 48 hours.  Provide agent with teh name and hospital of the prescribing physician.  No entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores or where drug paraphernalia is sold.  Anger management counseling and criminal thinking counseling.  No contact with M.E. and Eanelli Pharmacy.  May not oper a MV w/out a valid DL and with approval of agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Paul T Dorst in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation on Count 1.  Attorney Steinman went through PSI with defendant.  State gives final statement.  Attorney Steinman gives final statement.  State advises victim notification met.  Defendant makes statement.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
WI State Prison for 4 years (2 years Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision)  69 days credit. (3/14/2014 - 5/22/2014)
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Submit to random urinalysis
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol, unless prescribed by doctor and used accordingly.  Provide Rx to agent within 48 hours.  Provide agent with the name and hospital of the prescribing physician.  
No entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores or where drug paraphernalia is sold.  
Anger management counseling
Maintain full time employment.
Undergo criminal thinking counseling.
No contact with M.E. and Eanelli Pharmacy
May not oper a MV w/out a valid DL and approval of agent.  
$268.00 Costs & $10.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing Memorandum from Aimee Hasenfus
Sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Paul T Dorst in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steinman notes he has contacted client services dept and they are going to do an alternative PSI.  Need reset to late January.  Court resets.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on December 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on December 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Paul T Dorst in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Steinman not ready to proceed, DE never recv'd PSI and after seeing the offer may be asking for an additional PSI.  Requests reset.  State has no grounds to object.  Court grants reset.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Paul T Dorst in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to amend bond from $2000 to $10,000 cash bond.  ADA Newton requests $10,000 Cash that based upon he pled to this case and now has pending case.  Atty. Steinman makes objection the $2000 has kept DE here so DE will just credit for 4 days if amended to $10,000.  State now withdraws motion.  Court withdraws motion.
Cover Letter from James Williams
Motion hearing on November 10, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinman requesting reset.  Just met client today.  Previously Attorney Woodard's case.   PSI received recently, no time to discuss case with defendant.  State has no objection.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea entered to Ct. 1, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Report to be done by Sept. 29, 2014.  

Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on August 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will be pleading to the charge.  Request a few days to get orders in line.  Request new date for plea/possible PSI request.  Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Stanley V Woodard in court.  John A Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard notes he advised DA that he got a call yesterday and then again this morning from the DE that he couldn't be here today due to transportation issues.  States DE doesn't intend to try this case and wishes to settle matter at the FPT on 8/4/2014.  Matter will be resolved on that date.  Bond continued.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant Paul T Dorst in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 3.
Arraignment on April 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Paul T Dorst in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard states DE will waive prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Return date on April 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Paul T Dorst appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request cash bond.  Older criminal history.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Employed and resides locally.  No warrant history. Time limits waived. $2000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with pharmacy identified in complaint.  No possession of controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
